text: Draught @ Bahler Neuhaus. Pours cloudy deep yellow with a White head. White crusty bread and floral hops. Grassy and hayish with a twist of lemon. Dry hoppy finish. Boom!

Tap @ Source. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is loads of bready character, fresh citrusy hops, slight honey, very well balaned - Very czech style alike in malt charater. Creamy, clean, Crisp. Good brew

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ on the eve and after the Neuhauser Tag der Kommunbrauer, before the storm 02-04-10/2015. - - 1st sample on Friday: Deep golden-greenyellow pour, dense white cap. Amazingly "wild" nose, bretty pollen, daffodil and dandelion flowers on a summery meadow - near-saison like (Saison de Cazeau) - fascinating. At the same time some rubbery smoked notes, near-medicinal like an Islay whiskey - must be that coolship? Lots of confidently bitter milk thistle notes (Saison Dupont), hints of smoked rubber on thick, honey-drizzled pilsner malts. - 2nd batch, post onstorm 04/10/2015 had much less of this wild profile and shows how much batches can differ even at the same Zoiglwirt. Common theme: bitter noble hops (melissa, nettle, thistle milk, dandelion) meet dry vegetable oil, honeylike palate. The most captivating and memorable of all W-Bach and Neuhäuser Zoigls this weekend.

Vom Faß beim Bahler, 19.5.2015. - Goldgelb mit leichtem Orangeton, schwach trüb. - Leichter (noch angenehmer) Geruch nach Bauernhof (Kuhstall), dazu etwas Orange und Gras. - Antrunk sehr mild, zunächst fast dünn; schwach malzig mit einem Hauch von Karamel. Im weiteren Verlauf bittert es unerwartet stark nach mit nicht allzu kräftigem aber aromatischem Hopfen: Orangenschale, Gras, etwas Pfeffer. Schwach rezent, schlank und leicht mineralisch, dadurch enorm süffig: man könnte stundenlang weitertrinken. Schön bitterer Nachtrunk mit Pfeffer. - Sehr schöner Zoigl: schwach gespundet, anfangs mild, dann aber von aromatischer Bittere. Unglaublich süffig.
The head is medium, the body brown and very cloudy. It smells sweet-malty. The taste is malty, aromatic, a bit hoppy, a bit sweet. Overall ok. 11/10/11/11/-/11

on tap at zoigltag in 09 and 10, usually worth settling in here for a couple. looks great - faintly hazy golden with a steady white head; aroma of hay, passionfruit nectar and sandstone; crisp and invigorating, grassy, cumquat with some lurking butterscotch. excellent drinking

At Beim Bahler, Neuhaus 11/07/2011. Deep, clear gold with a frothy white head. Biscuit malt aroma with a touch of citrus fruit and dusty hop. Flavour had more fruit, a touch of caramel leading to a hoppy, bitter finish. Excellent stuff.

Slighly hazy, mostly clear, deep gold with foamy head. Aroma is worty-sweet and yeasty. Not the most sophisticated zoigl but still nice. The body is sturdy as are the maltz and the overall impression is sweet, yeasty and sticky but balanced.
Dull gold.  The aroma shows a hint of butter.  The taste is ok, though, a bit buttery.  Fairly bland and sweetish zoigl.
Cloudy golden with a medium off white head. Grassy hops in the nose with malty hints. Very dry flavor with plenty of grassy hops. Finished dry and bitter.
Tap. Cloudy yellow, white head. Yeasty, citruspeel, clay, bitter grassy hops. Medium to light, chewy dry mouthfeel. Feels like a Pilsner served in a unbaked clay mug. Unspoilt, fresh.
Tap.  Sweet buttery malt aroma.  Mostly clear golden yellow color with a small head.  Sweet creamy malt and moderately bitter grass hops flavor.  Very nice - the hoppiest Zoigl Ive had.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2014 October 2009: the first and last zoigl of the night. first impressions were a bit wonky as they had just begun pouring and the carbonation and body seemed  flabby and lifeless. but later that night its conditioned had changed remarkably and it was "on". appearance was hazy golden wheat with a rocky and soft fine-bubbled white head. nose is malt/grain-rich with spiced / rustic honey, apples, butter and hay, with snappy malt and a minerally and zesty yeast quality. amazingly fresh and vibrant, exceptionally deep and complex, and immeasurably drinkable. froth and rich texture, perfectly mashed, perfectly structured. i drank a lot of this later during the night. (4.3)

August 2014:  We wedding crashed Zoiglstube Bahler on a Saturday night, sneaking inside to taste a small glass and being told to sit outside next to the wedding guests where they poured us a small glass of the Zoiglbier.  Unfortunately it was in terrible shape.  Strong diacetyl, lots of sugar, flabby mouth feel. Boo on this.  (2.4)

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2011 (draught) pours a hazy golden colour with a frothy white head, good lacing. aroma of characteristic butter, green tea, tobacco and peaches, slightly meaty. flavour is mostly buttered grain, slightly minerally, with a herbal-hoppy finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

On tap @ beerfestival zwevegem.
Amber color, with a good white head.
Aroma good malts, caramel.
Medium bdoy. Taste sweet, malts, some spice, hops. Special.
Draught: Almost hazy, golden with a quite small fluffy head; solid dry bitter-sweet flavour, soft MF, light bodied, chalky base; lingering bitter-sweet finish. A goody..........

Draught, at Beim Bahler in Neuhaus, October 2006. Faintly hazy gold, moderate thin white head and gentle condition. Restrained sweet malt and dominant peppery hoppiness in the aroma, pleasantly yeasty-sweet in the mouth with a developing caramel note and a building but restrained hop bitterness. Long dry and bitter finish that comes both from the hops and the yeastiness. Much drier and hoppier than the Zoigl across the river in Windischeschenbach.
"

Bottle. Pale Yellow. This was quite a ncie lager. Bready/doughy malt notes, with a slightly sticky mouthfeel, which is balanced by some grassy hop bitterness in the finish. The bitterness is quite soft and makes the beer quite more-ish. A pleasant lager!

Pale yellow colour, low carbonation, cloudy. Resin, pine, butter, tobacco and spice aromas; bitter taste with resin, tobacco, pepper and wood aromas; very bitter finish with wood, resin, hop, spice and pepper aromas.
A wonderful, light, very hoppy beer - like a top-quality Franconian Kellerbier. One of the best lagers Ive ever had. 89 out of 100 on my scale.

Diesen Zoigl habe ich in einer 1l-Flasche mit nach Dresden genommen, wobei das im Bezug auf das Gebinde wohl eher einem Syphon gleicht. Stark würziger und malziger Geruch, deutliche Spuren des Karamellmalz. Ebenfalls starke Würze im Geschmack, gut gehopft, karamellmalzig und SEHR herber Abgang. Feines Bier!
Bottle at LCRBM 2, Kulminator, Antwerp, Belgium Hazy blond body.  White, frothy head.  Nose of hops, soap.  Moderately bitter, lightly salty flavour.  Moderately bitter finish.  Quite hoppy bitter!

LCRBM2. Bottle from Derdoppelbock. I always find the first beer of a tasting difficult, because you dont want to start too high or too low as you then guage everything off that benchmark. But I did rather like this. Golden with thin white head.  Pale malt aroma, bit dusty, some sticvky toffee in mouth, and then dry, tangy finish. Nice, interesting.  Good lasting tangy finish, if a little uncultured.

Bottled - LCRBM2 - A quite clear golden coloured beer with a touch of off-white head.  The aroma is buttery with some popcorn notes.  The taste has a touch of toffee and a litttle spice.  Tastes home brew and a little farty rough.  OK.  I didnt really enthuse although I am very grateful for tasting a true Zoigl.
Bottled, LCRBM. Very malty aroma with herbs and hints of butter. Light hazy, small off-white head, fair lace. Malty, loads of hops, sweet and bitter. Dry mouthfeel.

[2nd Low Countries RateBeer meeting] Aroma of sour cream, malts and floral hops. Slightly hazy, yellow coloured with not much head. bit sweet, but overall bitter taste, hoppy, flowery. Well balanced. Nice!

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2009 From bottle: sour cream, butter and hops in the aroma. Butter, chewing gum, loads of flowery and earthy hops, especially revealing itself in the aftertaste. Hint of wood and butter in the aftertaste. Low on carbon. In spite of a very rural mouthfeel, this is very special beer. (7 2 8 2 15 = 3.4)

Tap @ zoiglstube. Blonde, just a bit hazy. Flowery, just a bit soapy aroma. Initial malty flavor with earthy hops and some citrus notes. Long flowery aftertaste with citrus.

Golden, light amber hazy coloured with a small white head. Sweet malty aroma, with some cream touches. Light body with a stronger finish, hoppy with some herbal touches. Very nice beer. Thanks Der Doppelbock

Little white head; golden colour with a very slight haze.  Terribly malty, grassy nose, slightly smokey. Sweet initially, but with a very fine hoppy lining, especially coming up in the finish. Light, but grist slickness, refreshing. This is UNBELIEVABLE! Der Doppelbock upped everybody with this super addition to the knowledge here. And it was worth all the trouble, IMO.
